summary: Consumer electronics contain gold, platinum, rare earth metals, and other high value materials. Domestic recycling of electronics could reduce the U.S. reliance on imports of these materials. However, electronics recycling is complex and faces challenges, such as a lack of profitability. Electronics require disassembly by hand or shredding and separation. Emerging technologies could make it easier. For example, a manufacturer is piloting robotic disassembly for...
title: Science & Tech Spotlight: Consumer Electronics Recycling
